titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Robert and Edward Jett, Judgment
CWG7257

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
McCracken Circuit Court Oct 26th 1865
Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
against } Tippling house
Robert & Edward Jett Defendants

The parties appeared by their attorneys & by agreement the questions of law and fact arising in this case are submitted to the decision of the court without the intervention of a jury, And having heard the evidence adduced -- It is adjudged by the court that the defendant Robert Jett is guilty as charged in the indictment, and that the plaintiff recover of him the sum of Sixty dollars, and also the costs of the prosecution
It is adjudged by the court that the defendant Ed Jett is not guilty, and that he dismissed be discharged and go hence without
A Copy -- attest B Small C M c c

Comlth of Ky
vs } Copy judgt
Robt Jett
